meanings.definition: A pointed rod used to drive cattle.
meanings.sent1: The farmer used a sharp goads to guide the cows.
meanings.sent2: The goads helped the rancher move the herd to the pasture.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous goat tried to eat the goads, thinking they were tasty treats.
meanings.sent4: The goads of the herder's staff guided the animals like a compass needle.
meanings.sent5: The shiny goads gleamed in the sunlight, catching the eye of the curious calf.

meanings.definition: To provoke or annoy someone to stimulate some action or reaction.
meanings.sent1: His constant teasing goads his little sister into chasing him around the yard.
meanings.sent2: The coach goads the players to give their best performance on the field.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy goads the older dog into a game of chase around the backyard.
meanings.sent4: Her competitive spirit goads her to push herself harder in every race.
meanings.sent5: The motivational speaker's words goads the audience to pursue their dreams with determination.
